episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics, including the unique habits of a pioneering female composer, the manufacturing process of TV screens, an unusual art exhibition that caused seasickness, and the peculiar hunting habits of hyenas.

facts.fact: The first female composer to become a dame used to tie herself to trees to improve her posture.
TV screens are cut from a massive TV screen called the mother glass.
Queen Charlotte once got seasickness while visiting an art exhibition on land.
When hyenas hunt, they often go for low-hanging fruit; they especially like buffalo testicles.
